content:
A series of weeklong workshops has been planned for kids this summer by

UT Community Programs PERIOD

These workshops titled  are handson interactive programs which

explore the arts and sciences said Nissa DahlinBrown program

coordinator PERIOD

The programs are taught by highly qualified graduate students researchers

and UT staff PERIOD

According to Brown  is a place for all types of children whether

they are outgoing or shy PERIOD

 Brown said PERIOD

Since class size is limited some programs are already sold out but a few

remain open PERIOD

 is for children in

grades  PERIOD It will be offered June  from  p.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD This class

will include lecture and discussion work with actual bones and computer

research PERIOD

 will be held for grades  PERIOD Students in this

class will work with UT graduate students conducting experiments and

learning about properties of popular household products PERIOD This class will be

held from June  from  p.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD

 for grades  will be held July  from 

p.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD This is a handson fiction class which will help develop a

sense of language and improve writing skills PERIOD

 is a workshop which will involve studying rocket flight

including principles of light history and rocket design PERIOD It will held Aug PERIOD

 from  p.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD

Stacy Smith member of Graduate Researchers in Ecology Behavior and

Evolution will participate in the workshops this summer PERIOD Members of GREBE

are participating for two reasons PERIOD These are to aid in community service

and to raise money for graduate school travels and research PERIOD

According to Smith four classes will be taught by members of GREBE PERIOD She

expects these workshops to become an annual event PERIOD

There is a fee for each class and limited availability PERIOD Most programs are

limited to  or less PERIOD For a complete list of locations and class

offerings contact UT Community Programs at  or

UTCommunitygateway.ce.utk.edu PERIOD
